channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MD
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MD

item.title: Report X-2023090987
item.description:
Report X-2023090987

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-19T15:12:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-17
  • City: HAGERSTOWN
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS PICKED UP ON UNLOAD WET, LEAKING AND DAMAGED DescribePack: UPON INSPECTION FOUND 4 OUT OF 4 BOTTLES TO HAVE A LOOSE CAP WHICH ALLOWED THE PRODUCT TO LEAK OUT. BASED ON THE AMOUNT THAT LEAKED AND THE DAMAGE TO THE PACKAGE THE ORIENTATION ARROWS WERE NOT UTLIZED PROPERLY. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: RED TOTE

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered leaking during load in the sortation. QA was called and it was placed in a plastic lined tote. DescribePack: The can was dented and the lid was propped up and open, spilling contents. DurationRel: 9 and MitigateEffect: Placed in plastic lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2023090893
item.description:
Report X-2023090893

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-18T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-13
  • City: BELTSVILLE
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023090893 SequenceEvent: I found wet package in damage hazmat cage. I repacked damage in a salvage drum and filled out all required reports. DescribePack: About 1 pint of content leaked from a loose cap on containers. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The wet package was place in a tub and taken to the damage hazmat cage for processing. 2. X-2023091106 SequenceEvent: I found ripped, torn and wet package in the damage hazmat cage. I repacked hazmat in a salvage drum and completed all required reports. DescribePack: The package failure was because of a loose cap on one of the containers. About a quart of content spilled. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The wet leaking package was placed in a tub and taken to the damage hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023090861
item.description:
Report X-2023090861

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-18T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-15
  • City: SPARROWS POINT
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During QA dock walk located the package damaged at work area 629. Retrieved cleaning materials and Hazmat tote and safely cleaned the area. The package was placed under the ventilation system in the Hazmat cage. DescribePack: Due to the inside container leaking caused the outer container to become wet. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Spill absorb was used to mitigate the effects of the mess.

item.title: Report X-2023080906
item.description:
Report X-2023080906

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-19T15:12:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-08
  • City: ELKRIDGE
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The trailer arrived to 048/BAL with the spill of sulfuric acid present. The Operations Supervisor said there two spots where the sulfuric ~acid splashed in the nose of the trailer. The drum was shrink wrapped to the pallet. The shrink wrap gave way, causing the drum to fall ~over and spill.
